bwwExcerpt: Playing Walter Burns, the pugnacious bulldog managing editor of Chicago's Herald-Examiner, Nathan Lane doesn't enter until an hour and 45 minutes into The Front Page. But in a performance that's a master class in the art of the ferocious farceur, Lane causes the energy level to skyrocket and stay aloft throughout the remainder of this sturdy chestnut by one-time newspapermen Ben Hecht and Charles MacArthur, which remains the definitive American play about ink-stained tabloid wretches.
